actions.recommendation: Ultra sensitive CRP is an inflammatory marker used to predict risk of cardiovascular disease. I recommend that you recheck your level in approximately two weeks. It can also be raised during an infection so do the test when you are well.
Try to follow an anti inflammatory, Mediterranean style diet rich in colourful vegetables, healthy fats such as olives, avocado, olive oil, nuts and seeds, good quality protein and fatty fish.
Ultra sensitive CRP of 3.6mg/L falls into the high risk category for predicting cardiovascular disease in the next 10 years.
Non smoker, Minimal alcohol consumption, Exercises 5 times per week (strength & cardio)
Suboptimal vitamin D level of 25ng/ml (ideal is between 50-80)
Supplement with Omegagenics EPA DHA Omega 3 oil 2 capsules daily to support overall health and decrease inflammation.

Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck your level in 4 to 6 months, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml (not more than 100). Once your level is optimal you can decrease the dosage to 1000iu daily.
